text.p: Ceval issued the following statement on its 1996 results.
NOTE: All data provided in U.S. dollars. Share profit figures provided per 1,000 shares.
The company said in a statement its net profit in the second half of 1996 overshadowed the $12.3 million loss posted in the first half of the year.
Last year, Ceval's revenues rose four percent over 1995 while its exports reached $1.3 billion, an increase of 11.9 percent.
Domestic sales totalled $1.39 billion last year, a drop of 2.7 percent over 1995, it added.
It said its gross operating margins last year fell 11.3 percent over 1995 due to an increase in raw material prices.
